result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

VRCW. 

Defendant indicates he does not plan on obtaining counsel.

COURT to set pre trial so parties can discuss.

No contact with victim(s): S.B. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence (Mosinee P.D.)  Absolute sobriety  from and no possession of alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (2) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Heather. 
Case called: 3:12 p.m. 

State appears by ADA Alex Lech.  Defendant appears from MCJ via Zoom, with Atty Paige Metzman, in person.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
PLEA: NOT GUILTY on CM's

COURT ORDERS: $500.00 signature bond.

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): S.B.
- Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence (Mosinee PD). 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  
- No possession or use of dangerous weapons. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
